abstract: Thousands of inmates in the Texas prison system have been eating fewer meals after officials stopped serving lunch on the weekends in some prisons as a way to cut food-service costs.
snippet: Inmates have been eating fewer meals since April after officials stopped serving lunch on the weekends as a way to trim $2.8 million in food-service costs.
lead_paragraph: Inmates have been eating fewer meals since April after officials stopped serving lunch on the weekends as a way to trim $2.8 million in food-service costs.

headline.main: In Bid to Cut Costs at Some Texas Prisons, Lunch Will Not Be Served on Weekends
headline.print_headline: In Bid to Cut Costs at Some Texas Prisons, Lunch Will Not Be Served on Weekends
headline.seo: Texas Reduces Weekend Meals for Prisoners
